bug.author: shirriff
bug.summary: API pages could use some search optimization
bug.description:
When I search on Google for Tensorflow methods, the documentation is hard to distinguish in the search results. The API pages have irrelevant titles and aren't as highly ranked as they should be. To reproduce: Search for [tf extract_image_patches] Expected behavior: I get a result with the API documentation: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/array_ops.html>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/array_ops.html</denchmark-link>
Observed behavior: this page shows up as result 3 with the mysterious title "tf.pack - TensorFlow" Another example is EveryN. If I add enough keywords, I get the API page as result 4 (search on [tf EveryN api tf.contrib.learn]). But it has the inscrutable title "tf.contrib.learn.monitors.ExportMonitor.run_on_all_workers - TensorFlow" This makes it difficult to find the documentation for methods. Suggested fix: maybe make the page titles more descriptive, and add the word "API"? Maybe have separate pages for each class, like JavaDocs?

comments.comment:
I concur, search could use improvement. For example, I go to main API page and search for "segment_max" -- <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/s/results/?q=segment_max&p=%2F>https://www.tensorflow.org/s/results/?q=segment_max&p=%2F</denchmark-link>
This gives "segment_max" as second result, but when you go there, it has broken images/broken links because it's actually for version 0.10

One more example: <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15331/23146994/ad180d1c-f7a9-11e6-9804-7011a1143c12.png></denchmark-link>
Each option for Initializers links to a different API version.

For some things, gitbook search works better. Latest gitbook is at <denchmark-link:https://haosdent.gitbooks.io/tensorflow-document/content/api_docs/>https://haosdent.gitbooks.io/tensorflow-document/content/api_docs/</denchmark-link> and tracking issue for gitbook updates is <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/3810>#3810</denchmark-link>
Closing due to lack of recent activity. Since this issue is old at this point, please reopen the issue if it still occurs when tried with the latest documentation. Thank you.
